text: The Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, commonly known as the Federal Reserve Board, is the main leading body of the Federal Reserve System. It is in charge with overseeing the Federal Reserve Banks and with helping control the monetary policy of the United States. Governors are appointed by the president of the United States and confirmed by the Senate for a 14-year term.See It is headquartered in the Eccles Building in Washington, D.C. ==Current members== The current members of the Board of Governors are as follows: Portrait Current governor Party Term start Term expires (Chair) Republican (as Chair) (reappointment) (as Chair) (Chair) Republican (as Governor) (reappointment) (as Governor) (Vice Chair) Democratic (as Vice Chair) (as Vice Chair) (Vice Chair) Democratic (as Governor) (as Governor) (Vice Chair for Supervision) Democratic (as Vice Chair for Supervision) (as Vice Chair for Supervision) (Vice Chair for Supervision) Democratic (as Governor) (as Governor) Republican (reappointment) Republican Democratic (reappointment) Democratic ==References== Category:Federal government of the United States Category:1914 establishments in the United States
title: Federal Reserve Board of Governors
